alert.note: Alert for Sandusky; Wood (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 28 at 11:07PM EST until March 01 at 11:30PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Portage River At Woodville affecting Wood and Sandusky Counties. For the Portage River...including Woodville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Portage River At Woodville. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, The river inundates lower portions of Trail Marker Park and is out of banks in Pemberville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 9.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 PM EST Tuesday was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.7 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.7 feet on 03/13/1962. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 915 AM EST.
